title.narrative: Support to El Nino affected areas

description.narrative:
Objective 1: To reduce impact of drought/saltwater intrusion crisis in the most vulnerable and severely affected districts of Ben Tre Province and to build emergency response capacity for local partners in Ben Tre and neighboring provinces in Mekong Delta
This year 9/13 Mekong Delta provinces have been seriously affected by drought and saline intrusion, including Long An, Tien Giang, Hau Giang, Ben Tre, Tra Vinh, Soc Trang, B#c Lieu, Ca Mau, Kien Giang. Out of which 6 provinces have declared saline intrusion disaster status, including: Ben Tre, Tien Giang, Long An, Soc Trang, Ca Mau, and Kien Giang.
Given the fact that Ben Tre has been considered the worst affected province, Oxfam plans to work with local government and technical departments to focus our response efforts in 3 coastal districts. Coordination meetings with Ben Tre Red Cross Chapter and concerned agencies at provincial, district, and commune levels to agree on response standards and requirements for relief efforts and avoid duplication will be facilitated by Oxfam Mekong team based in Ben Tre city.
At the end of May, Oxfam and Ben Tre provincial Red Cross Chapter shall co-organize a provincial lesson learning workshop on drought/saltwater disaster response management (emergency coordination, participatory needs assessment, applyingminimum standards in all response cycles (designing, planning, implementation, M<(>&<)>E), enhancing downward accountability to people we seek to assist through complaint management mechanism, etc. Participants of this event include government, local authorities, and relevant response actors in Ben Tre and neighboring provinces (Tra Vinh, Tien Giang, etc.) for exchanges, learning and sharingof good response practices for building back better to similar crisis scenarios in the future.

participating-org.narrative: DARD Ben Tre has a long relation with Oxfam from first phase (9/2009-3/2010) on "Managing climate risk through livelihood diversification". The 2nd phase (9/2010-3/2012) Building equitable resilience to the impacts of climate change and disasters in BenTre province, Vietnam" then has continued with this project until now. The purpose of the project is "Building resilience for poor people (especially women) and local authorities to disaster risks and climate change in coastal communities". The model of change that the project targets is to provide new practise, conduct tests, then advocate to apply them widely in different communities. Project Implementer is responsible for collaborating with Oxfam to carry out this project in order to achieve the project objectives/Coordinating the relevant parties involving in project implementation to ensure to achieve the project expected objectives, to ensure to target the right beneficiaries and to deliver the project outputs to the beneficiaries in a clear and transparent manner;/Facilitating to setup working mechanism, working functions for local institutions at Province, district and commune level who will participate in the project activities.
Department of Agriculture and Rural Development in Ben Tre Provin

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
